oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Order of protection issued at Gallatin, Tennessee, for Mary Taylor of Sumner County
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; War -- Protection of civilians
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This order of protection for Miss Mary Taylor of Sumner County was issued by General E. A. Paint at the Federal Headquarters at Gallatin. It permits her to travel in the daytime to and from all places within the Federal lines in the prosecution of her lawful business. It further protects her property from trespassing or destruction.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Orders of protection were issued to civilians to prevent troops from foraging on their property or detaining them as spies should their professions cause them to enter encampments, pickets, or lines.
